p: In the case of adulteration, it is possible to detect adulterated olive oil with levels as low as 1 to 5% of hazelnut oil, based on glycerophospholipids as biochemical markers [ 13]. This is a significant advantage since adulteration of extra VOO with hazelnut oil cannot be straightforwardly detected by well-established techniques because these oils have similar triacylglycerol, fatty acid, and sterol profiles [ 24].
